On 2002-06-12 at 15:26 pholser wrote:

><jbr>
>> What I really want is a Bag, dammit. Why didn't Java give us a Bag?!
></jbr>
>
>not to flog the "collection assertion" dead horse too much longer,
>but to treat an array or List as a bag, could you simply sort it and
>then compare equals()?

Yes, although if you already have two Collections, the code becomes
rather unwieldy, as you must convert to an array, which is such ugly
code:

    final String[] s1 = (String[]) myCollection.toArray(new
String[myCollection.size()]);

Yuck. I can't understand why Java didn't hide this craziness from us.
